text: President Obama calls for an overhaul of
government data collection what he said
his evolution on the issue and
implications going forward today on the
New York Times many intelligence
agencies will now be required to obtain
permission before they tap into their
vast phone databases I am therefore
ordering a transition that will end the
section 215 bulk metadata program as it
currently exists but the data itself
remains for now under government control
with the speech the president is taking
out the middle ground
something then-senator Obama might have
disagreed with this is just plain wrong
but as often happens such tactics look
different from the Oval Office
my assessment and my team's assessment
was that they help us prevent terrorist
attacks and something to watch going
forward the speech was designed to
placate civil liberties advocates
without rupturing relations with the
national security agencies that have
been concerned that his reforms my
handcuffed them in the hunt for
terrorism one thing that does seem
certain is that neither side will be
completely happy
